ul.li1: 261 Like snow in the summer and like rain at the harvest,
ul.li2: so honor is not fitting for a fool.
ul.li1: 2Like the sparrow is to fluttering and like the swallow is to flying,
ul.li2: so an undeserved curse does not go forth.
ul.li1: 3A whip for the horse, a bridle for the donkey,
ul.li2: and a rod for the back of fools.
ul.li1: 4Do not answer a fool according to his folly
ul.li2: lest you become like him—even you.
ul.li1: 5Answer a fool according to his folly,
ul.li2: or else he will be wise in his own eyes.
ul.li1: 6Like cutting off feet or drinking violence,
ul.li2: so is he who sends messages in the hand of a fool.
ul.li1: 7Like legs that hang limp from a lame person,
ul.li2: so is a proverb in the mouth of fools.
ul.li1: 8Like binding a stone in a sling,
ul.li2: so is giving honor to a fool.
ul.li1: 9Like a thorn that goes up in the hand of a drunkard,
ul.li2: so is a proverb in the mouth of fools.
ul.li1: 10Like an archer who wounds everyone,
ul.li2: so is he who hires a fool or he who hires passersby.
ul.li1: 11Like a dog returning to his vomit
ul.li2: is a fool reverting to his folly.
ul.li1: 12Do you see a man wise in his own eyes?
ul.li2: There is more hope for a fool than for him.
ul.li1: 13A lazy person says “A lion is in the road!
ul.li2: A lion among the streets!”
ul.li1: 14The door turns on its hinge,
ul.li2: and a lazy person on his bed.
ul.li1: 15A lazy person buries his hands in the dish;
ul.li2: he is too tired to return it to his mouth.
ul.li1: 16A lazy person is wiser in his eyes
ul.li2: than seven who answer discreetly.
ul.li1: 17Grabbing onto the ears of a dog
ul.li2: passing by is one who meddles in a quarrel that is not his own.
ul.li1: 18Like a maniac who shoots
ul.li2: firebrands, arrows, and death,
ul.li1: 19so is a man who deceives his neighbor,
ul.li2: but says “Am I not joking?”
ul.li1: 20For lack of wood, a fire goes out,
ul.li2: and where there is no whisperer, quarreling will cease.
ul.li1: 21As charcoal is to hot embers and wood is to fire,
ul.li2: so a man of quarrels is to kindling strife.
ul.li1: 22The words of a whisperer are like delicious morsels,
ul.li2: and they go down to the inner parts of the body.
ul.li1: 23Like impure silverLiterally “silver of impurities” which overlays an earthen vessel,
ul.li2: so are smooth lips and an evil heartOr “mind”.
ul.li1: 24On his lips, an enemy will pretend,
ul.li2: but insideLiterally “in his midst” he will harbor deceit.
ul.li1: 25When he makes his voice gracious, do not believe him,
ul.li2: for seven abominations are in his heart.
ul.li1: 26Though hatred is covered with guile,
ul.li2: its evil will be exposed in the assembly.
ul.li1: 27He who digs a pit, in it he will fall,
ul.li2: and he who rolls a stone, on him it will come back.
ul.li1: 28A tongue of deceit hates its victim,
ul.li2: and a flattering mouth makes ruin.
